document_data.caption: ''Various depictions of rods of absorption.''
document_data.name: ''Rod of Absorption''
document_data.value2e: 40,000 [[gp]]The one in [[Baldur's Gate II]] has a price is lower than normal. This is assumed to be because of its single charge left.
document_data.mainbody: A '''''rod of absorption''''' was a very rare type of magical [[rod]].
document_data.Description: The rod was typically yellow in color, with metal caps at each end. These were engraved with yellow runes.
document_data.Construction: One given example method for the construction of a ''rod of absorption'' involved burying a green shoot taken from an apple tree at harvest time with a topaz and the magic item most used by the creator inside a cedar box. Using a ''[[limited wish]]'', the topaz turned to dust and the item was ruined after a month, but the apple shoot was ready for enchantment. The final step of the enchantment involved the ashes of a vellum used as a scroll for an unknown spell.{{cite dragon/101/Charging isn't cheap|30}}
document_data.History: In {{yearlink|1374}}, [[Fhaornik]] attempted to destroy a [[nishruu]] by throwing a ''rod of absorption'' at it, after the creature was released to attack [[Blackstaff Tower]]. His attempt was unsuccessful.{{cite book/Blackstaff/MMP|37|3}}
